intro: Claytonia chamissonis, commonly known as the "spring beauty," is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink or white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a short, succulent stem with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and meadow habitats. Claytonia chamissonis is known for its rapid growth and ability to bloom before many other spring flowers.
